meanings.definition: Those who do not believe in a particular religion or set of beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The unbelievers did not attend the church service.
meanings.sent2: The group of unbelievers had different views on spirituality.
meanings.sent3: The unbelievers jokingly called themselves the 'non-belief club'.
meanings.sent4: In the land of believers, the unbelievers were seen as outsiders.
meanings.sent5: The unbelievers' lack of faith was evident in their conversations.

meanings.definition: People who reject or do not accept a certain idea or concept.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was disappointed by the unbelievers in the class.
meanings.sent2: The project faced opposition from the unbelievers in the team.
meanings.sent3: The unbelievers stubbornly refused to try the new method.
meanings.sent4: In the debate, the unbelievers stood firm in their disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The group discussion was lively with believers and unbelievers sharing their thoughts.
